page.title: 10Recreation in South Benfleet
page.content: The drained marshland area in South Benfleet is extensively used as playing fields by cricket and soccer clubs.There are also facilities for Bowls,Tennis and playgrounds for very young children.To the east of the High Road is the 18 hole Boyce Hill Golf Course.Numerous riding stables cater for this popular pastime and the South -East Essex Riding Club holds regular events at the Council's Runnymede Paddocks,next to the Swimming Pool and Sports Hall,with facilities for badminton,table tennis and weight training.Several private enterprises organise fitness courses,training and dancing classes.During the summer school holidays a Play Leadership is organised for young people.Immediately to the south of this Block and part of South Benfleet is the Yacht Club by Benfleet Creek and the Flood Barrier.
